thread.title: Drugs, guns, conservation among proposed Maine legislation
thread.title_full: Drugs, guns, conservation among proposed Maine legislation

title: Drugs, guns, conservation among proposed Maine legislation
text:
Drugs, guns, conservation among proposed Maine legislation By - Associated Press - Monday, October 5, 2015 
AUGUSTA, Maine (AP) - Lawmakers and state agencies in Maine have submitted more than 400 requests for bills for the upcoming legislative session. 
The Portland Press Herald reports (http://bit.ly/1GsP5BQ ) the proposals include efforts to fight the state’s heroin and opiate epidemic, altering gun laws and protecting popular land conservation programs currently frozen by Gov. Paul LePage. 
The full details of the requests are not yet public and many of the bills are unlikely to receive approval from legislative leadership. But the bills that advance to the upcoming session are likely to be contentious, setting the stage for the 2016 legislative elections. 
The deadline to submit bill titles was Sept. 25. The Legislative Information Office published a full list of bill requests by lawmakers and agencies on Friday. 
___ 
Information from: Portland Press Herald, http://www.pressherald.com
